com.mysql.fabric.jdbc

Class FabricMySQLConnectionProxy

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mysql.jdbc.ConnectionPropertiesImpl
      • com.mysql.fabric.jdbc.FabricMySQLConnectionProxy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FabricMySQLConnection, FabricMySQLConnectionProperties, ConnectionProperties, MySQLConnection, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.sql.Connection, java.sql.Wrapper
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    JDBC4FabricMySQLConnectionProxy

    public class FabricMySQLConnectionProxy
extends ConnectionPropertiesImpl
implements FabricMySQLConnection, FabricMySQLConnectionProperties
    A proxy to a set of MySQL servers managed by MySQL Fabric. Limitations:
    • One shard key can be specified
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getActiveMySQLConnection

        protected MySQLConnection getActiveMySQLConnection()
                                            throws java.sql.SQLException
        Get the active connection as an object implementing the internal MySQLConnection interface. This should not be used unless a MySQLConnection is required. getActiveConnection() is provided for the general case. The returned object is not a ReplicationConnection, but instead the LoadBalancedConnectionProxy for either the master or slaves.
